intro: Justicia johannae, commonly known as the silver bush or silverleaf justicia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers, which bloom in clusters, are often violet or blue in color and attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It is well adapted to dry conditions and thrives in full sun.
